form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to treat certain misfiled documents as motions for reconsideration of decisions by the Board of Veterans' Appeals, and for other purposes.

section.header: Treatment of certain misfiled documents as motions for reconsideration of decisions by Board of Veterans' Appeals
section.text: Section 7103 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (d); and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c):

Except as provided in paragraph (2), if a person adversely affected by a final decision of the Board, who has not filed a notice of appeal with the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims under section 7266(a) of this title within the period set forth in that section, files a document with the Board or the agency of original jurisdiction referred to in section 7105(b)(1) of this title that expresses disagreement with such decision not later than 120 days after the date of such decision, such document shall be treated as a motion for reconsideration of such decision under subsection (a).
A document described in paragraph (1) shall not be treated as a motion for reconsideration of the decision under paragraph (1) if—

subparagraph.text: the Board or the agency of original jurisdiction referred to in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: receives the document described in paragraph (1);
determines that such document expresses an intent to appeal the decision to the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims; and
forwards such document to the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims; and

subparagraph.text: the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims receives such document within the period set forth by section 7266(a) of this title.
